Detailed Description

cvmx_spx::_tpa_sel

SPX_TPA_SEL - TPA watcher port selector

Notes: The TPA Watcher is primarily a debug vehicle used to help initial bringup of a system. The TPA watcher counts bytes that roll in from the Spi interface. The user programs the Spi port to watch using SPX_TPA_SEL[PRTSEL]. Once the TPA is deasserted for that port, the watcher begins to count the data ticks that have been delivered to the inbound datapath (and eventually to the IOB). The result is that we can derive turn-around times of the other device by watching how much data was sent after a loss of TPA through the SPX_TPA_ACC[CNT] register. An optional interrupt may be raised as well. See SPX_TPA_MAX for further information.

TPA's can be deasserted for a number of reasons...

1) IPD indicates backpressure 2) The GMX inbound FIFO is filling up and should BP 3) User has out an override on the TPA wires
